title: Full premades are a death sentence
body:
So this is something that has been bothering me.  I have groups of friends that I like to play with, all of us pretty casual.  None of us really play ranked, and if we did I doubt any of us would make it out of Bronze.  That's okay; none of us are interested in being esports contenders, just having the occasional night of fun matches.  There is some variance in our team's skill level, but nothing super dramatic.  Again, none of us even play ranked.

But every time, and I mean every time, we form a full 5-man premade group in ARAM or Team Builder, we get matched against a group that's practicing for ranked.  It's such a ludicrous bloodbath that we walk away, shattered husks of people, succor a distant memory.  I don't know how the MMR calculation works, but it seems to be broken somehow.

It's extremely annoying not being able to play with a full group of friends.  What's happening here?  Is there some reason we get put up against commando teams that wipe the floor with us every time we queue as a full group?

replies.body: Practice more and get better at the game?

I have a limited amount of time to dedicate to my hobbies, and other things I'd rather do than polish my skill at a video game.  I don't like the attitude that you don't matter unless you're a serious ranked player trying to reach the top.  It promotes obsessive and unhealthy behavior.  Matchmaking should work such that when I form a group of friends, it finds a group similar to our skill level for us to play against.

the more games you play, the more your mmr will shift. how many games do you all play as a group 5v5 premade? it automatically starts you at a base value and then shifts from there depending on the players you play and if you win or lose against those players.

If you lose against lower level players=more drop
if you win against higher level players=more gain

Do you know all this?

I second the comment someone else said... Create a ranked 5s team with all your friends and play your 10 qualifiers (over time if you must) and you'll end up in an appropriate level for you and your friends. From that point, hopefully you can just queue up for ranked 5s and play evenly (~usually) matched games.

Good luck, try to have fun, don't get too frustrated! (things I tell myself) :)
Seems a little sad that people who want to play casually have to actually play ranked. Not saying it's a bad suggestion, though.

I agree with this: you will definitely be matched appropriately this way. And if none of you truly care about ranked gameplay anyways, then I see no reason not to. 

Also, have you ever tried blind pick (instead of TB)?

I know that pre-made 5's are prioritized to be matched against other 5's, and I think it's more of a matter of the pool of choices itself than the calculation. In other words, there are a hell of a lot more pre-made 5's that will be on ranked teams (and queuing as 5 to practice) than casual pre-made 5's. Am I saying there's nothing to done? No, but until pre-made 5's are taken at a different approach (like a separate "ranked practice" que or something) there's not much to do simply on the available options for pairing.

The player base does not exist for a 6th SR map Q.

I think you are going at this the wrong way. Their is nothing wrong with the people that are trying to win. They might not even be practicing but are just better. The OP is here just to have "FUN" others are not. The issue is with him not the other player groups.

I'm not saying that the teams that beat us are the problem at all.  I don't fault people who are better than me just for being better than me.  I don't expect them to try to handicap themselves or anything.

But it's got to be extremely unsatisfying for them to face us.  We can't put up a meaningful fight against Gold-ranked guys.

When I say I'm just interested in playing for fun, I don't mean we're picking some kind of insane non-meta comps or playing champions we don't know.  I mean we're interested in competing against a group of similar skill level and having an enjoyable time in a fair contest.  Ideally, matchmaking would put us up against premades of similar skill.

I'd suggest actually trying some off-meta stuff, so that you at least have the element of surprise! Yasuo+Vi bot lane can get real bloody, real fast (for either side). Really, though, unless the enemy team is going full try hard mode, a little confusion plus a little coordination can combat a reasonable amount of coordination, and shaking things up with friends is always fun :)

You will find that level eventually that how the system works. Though the rouge plat/diamond is going to leak through with werid mmr.

What you should do for 5s is make a ranked team. The first 5 matchs are probably going to suck. But the team will have a group MMR instead of invidual MMR. Your team will end up in its spot and their should be less chance of running into Gold + players below Silver placements.
I agree the fracture of another que would not at all be the right way to go, especially for smaller regions. But beyond addressing it from the que side there's simply not much to be done.

The game has been like this since I first started playing way back in season 1. You cant play with a full group unless you're looking to either get crushed, or play super competitively. I wish it wasn't that way, but it is. Its ultimately why my play group fell apart. We had one player that was just awful, and while any one of us could carry her in a duo game, as a full team the burden was too much. Later on I played with an entirely different group, and we had a problem where when we were 4 premade with 1 random it didn't matter what the random was we would win almost every game. The moment we became a 5 premade though we basically sentenced ourselves to losses. We wanted to create a ranked 5s team, but because of the constant losses as a 5 premade we basically dropped the idea.

I actually have this happen to me a lot.
Thought no one in my team is unranked when we queue up as 5 being only high to low golds and silvers we get placed against high golds and high to low plats with an occasional diamond. I don't really mind the plats too much, everyone is capable of making mistakes but on multiple encounters I've had to go up against 1-2 diamonds sometimes them even being diamond 1 in premades.

It can really get frustrating.

> But every time, and I mean every time, we form a full 5-man premade group in ARAM or Team Builder

There is reason 1. Team builder is more for practicing champs. If you wanted something like that then try Normal Draft. As for aram's. Well I can't help you. Aram's are just that, Random. You either win or lose. not much you can do. 

>we get matched against a group that's practicing for ranked. It's such a ludicrous bloodbath that we walk away, shattered husks of people, succor a distant memory. I don't know how the MMR calculation works, but it seems to be broken somehow.

I once thought that too. But I realized after being matched with Plat's, and sometimes Diamond level players on the Regular in normal's (losing quite a bit of them) That my normal MMR was higher then it should. I tend to play alone when that starts happening. What that does is bring My personal MMR back down to where it should be. Not sure how it works, but Even beating the plat's solo brings my MMR back into line with gold's and high silver 1. 

>It's extremely annoying not being able to play with a full group of friends. What's happening here? Is there some reason we get put up against commando teams that wipe the floor with us every time we queue as a full group?

Well all I can say is play more. Get better with a select group of champs. If you and your mates constantly swap roles, try pitching the idea of sticking to certain roles. 

You also said you don't have much time to dedicate to Hobbies? Well it's really easy to misconstrued that. I was working 36 hours at one point while going to school. I was not only able to make time for other things but able to get a minimum of 4 games in a night. 4 games x 7 days is 28 games. 4 games isn't a lot but it's grows fast.

Well - before the 5x5 thing was an option matchmaking used to assume a premade team would have a significant edge on a group of players the same Elo that were just randomly thrown together, so in the case of finding a few duo, triple, or multiple solo queue players it would cobble together a team with a noteworthy Elo advantage.

I'd strongly recommend trying to figure out how your friends play and definitely use something like Skype, Vent, or another such program to easily communicate. Even when you're messing around, taking advantages matchamaking (and other premades) assume you're using can be a big help.

Well, i have a similar but still different problem:
If my friends and i deside to play a fun game, going for out of meta strats or random picks or what ever, we always face a tryhard team picking the god-tier meta champs...
I realy miss the S1/S2 times where people in blindpick played for fun and ignored tierlists and often meta.

i have no problem with tryharding in rankeds, i can understand people want to practice in draftpick for rankeds an therefor also tryhard, but in blindpick....seems to me most people play blindpick to pick the op-champs that otherwise are banned

I kinda like Sir ArmaMalums idea with a "ranked praktice" que, spliting draftpick into a 'casual draft' and 'praktice draft',  but having even more diffrent ques would evt lead to worse matchmaking as the pool for each que would get smaller

My friends and I did a team builder one day where we all picked fighters and tanks. For example, bot lane was Darius and Jarvan. Mid was Garen. I don't remember the other champs on our team. Anyway, we were a complete 5s queued for team builder and the team we faced was... 100% tank/fighter team. I know we didn't have "tank" or "fighter" specifically selected in our roles because we were all going for different icons, so we didn't care, but I guess team builder saw what we were doing and found another team just as funky, so we battled it out and won. Both teams had fun (the other team, though losing, kept spirits high and levity appropriate).

Guess it was rather luck for u guys, i never faced an enemy team playing outside the meta in teambuilder...then again, i never played teambuilder as 5man premade, as i somehow don't get the point of 5-man teambuilder....unless it matches u vs out of meta combs

Do you guys talk or skype or teamspeak or ventrillo? I think that might be a big difference. I play with friends a lot and we're not really "practicing for ranked" or anything, but we're usually in a skype call together (or even in the same room), which really helps team organization and stuff. 

That might be the difference?
You deserve it.
